column5: Spent the weekend up on the north end of Pigeon Lake, and for the most part the fishing was a little slow this year. A few bass were caught, all around 1lb... even the panfish were slow fishing.  After the rain had stopped on Monday morning, I decided we'd try trolling for walleye... as the water was choppy, the skies were gloomy. After only 15-20 minutes, fish on! First muskie landed, not a monster... A little shy of 3ft. Definitely made my weekend.
Saweeet!!!!
Nice fish man!
Nice looking ski - clean and dark green. Congrats!
Well done and congrats on your 1st, she's a beaut !!
Well done.
Great color on that one.   Congrats on number 1.
Lol how many of us have our first chasing walleye it's up stream from here. Congrats on the new obsession
Congrats!  What were you using?
Nice looking first musky without a doubt!  I'd go so far as to say chunky even. Well done. Only question is wether you caught that fish or it caught you? Cause once you get hooked, look out!
You are hooked now The journey to 50 inches begins  ?
Nice 'ski!!!! Woulda killed to see him a cpl weeks ago.
Right on!!!!!!!
way to go, i spent a whole weekend on pigeon and buckhorn chasing skis and came up with nothing, you got one in 15 minutes so congrats!
nice job thanks for the report
Beauty! I have the opposite happen to me...incidental walleye when musky fishing
Very nice,congrats !!!!
I like the colours on that fish, good job!!
Nice looking fish  Congrats
Congrats!
Very nice bud. Great catch.
Nice going ! Be careful they are very addictive.  ; )
Hahaha, highly addictive eh? I just need myself a boat first, then I can start trying to target them regularly. Man the fight difference between a muskie and a pike are quite astounding.
